column1: Tatiana's test
column25:
# After selecting the datasets_rec folder it took a while until the pop up appeared "Upload files to this Site?"
 # After pressing Upload, the next page(with upload progress) was not shown for a long time. I had to reload the page and repeat the upload
 # Uploading time seems to be increasing esp when switching to a new tab (could be that the browser (Chrome) is down prioritizing it when in the background?). Makes a weird user experience, because keeping the tab open for potentially a few hours of upload is not realistic
 # Typo? Uploading instead of Uploaded:
!https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-29%20at%2017.33.14.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567092809527&api=v2|height=250!
 # For some reason in the processed data, the same dataset appeared twice (although there was only 1 processing task): !https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-30%20at%2010.36.39.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567154315022&api=v2|height=250!!https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-30%20at%2010.36.55.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567154314752&api=v2|height=224!
 # When I pressed Copy to Dataset Management - the spinner appears, but during the process I can still check and uncheck datasets:
!https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-30%20at%2010.41.53.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567154635021&api=v2|height=250!
 # Copy to Dataset Management takes a long time, and the progress is not clear: !https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-30%20at%2010.46.46.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567154891646&api=v2|height=164!

column1: Upload stuck after computer went to sleep
column25:
h2. Description: I started upload of 4 datasets a day ago. My assumption is that the upload crashed when the computer went to sleep but there is no error and it looks like it's still uploading. Not sure what's happening in the background but it's already for a day like that. Check the pic for info :)
h2. Expected result: There is an error if the upload crashes
h2. Steps To Reproduce:
 # Put data to upload
 # Let computer go to sleep

h2. Environment:
h3. OS, Browser: Google Chrome
h3. Instance URL: [http://test-test-cloud-processing-18:8080/iv/]

column1: Workflow suggestions
column25:
# create a task before even being able to upload data. Then datasets can be sorted in a project like directory
 # Start processing directly from the upload page
 # Copy to dataset management? Why do we have this? Can we store web processed data directly there to avoid a need to copy anything. 
 #  Could all the processing be at the same page? we have menu for data processing, but then maps and navgraph under dataset management. It would be nice to have it all together. 
 # My new instance contained preexisting SiteModel and bundle file in the dataset management. - Was someone playing with it or we want to have predefined examples of the data?
column174:
03/Sep/19 4:45 PM;lc17zek;#3 - For cost reasons we want to keep the to be and processed data separately from the instance size

#5 - Might be because we are using the NVC build - let me look into it

column1: Processing progression is not shown in the percentage bar
column25: During processing, the progress bar is not moving during processing.

column1: Instance tech specs
column25:
I don't know what kind of instance this is but processing of the dataset of a size 1.4 GB took around 1 hour (post and web). 

On the local machine (128 GB RAM) it took 34 min. 

I'd expect Cloud to be faster than my local machine. 

Linked as well to: 
 # CTP-118
column174:
03/Sep/19 4:19 PM;mk19wep;To be investigated it might be fixed with https://jira.navvis.com/browse/MAP-4122 

[~pm18pil]
column175:
03/Sep/19 4:19 PM;lc17zek;We should get an outline of each section of the time pipeline and what resources are used.

 

Also test with the Pano rendering fix

column1: UI feedback
column25:
I'd put few UI changes to improve user experience

 
 # When the data was uploaded (after the progress bar went crazy) there was no feedback that it's actually uploaded. I would put a prompt of make it more visible within the dataset
 # I would expect to start data processing directly from the uploading page rather than going to a different menu 
 # It would be nice to have a visual sign that the processing is running. It took 6 min to annoy me that the progress bar is still at 0% - even that usual loading circle would be an indicator that something is moving :D
 # After processing of one dataset, I had 2 in the processed datasets page. They are named the same and I don't understand what they are (pic attached)
 # Instance shows me 8 licensed users in instance key settings - what kind of Cloud package is that :D?

column1: CTP - Bug report
column25:
h2. Description: There is not enough RAM to process maps and navgraph 
h2. Expected result: process maps and dynamically allocate necessary RAM
h2. Steps To Reproduce:
 # Go to dataset management
 # Click on process maps and navgraph

h2. Environment:
h3. OS, Browser: Chrome Version 76.0.3809.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)
h3. Instance URL:[http://test-test-cloud-processing-18:8080/iv/]

column1: Uploaded data vs upload data
column25:
Just a small point. If i don't press on the data upload prompt when i start the new instance, and i want to navigate to data upload through the menu bar, naming is a bit misguiding. 

I wouldn't necessarily go under uploaded data to find a place to upload new. 

In my opinion, it should be named "upload data" and there could be a history of uploaded ones. Something like downloading from browser. You press download but you have the overview of lately downloaded data.

column1: Deleting Dataset from the queue does not work
column25:
If I am uploading a dataset, and I have another dataset in the queue, when I try to delete the dataset in the queue, the "procedure" looks like to be completed, but the dataset does not disappear from the list. 

 

See attached video

column1: Data Upload not working on Microsoft Edge
column25:
I have tried to test on Microsoft Edge, and the data upload does not work ( does not start at all ).

 

See attached video.

column1: Would be nice to see "TimeStamps" for the datasets that are processed.
column25:
It might be a good idea to see when was a particular dataset under *Processed Data* tab was finished processing or generated *OR* at-least be able to see which *Processing Task* resulted in which dataset. Currently, nothing as such is visible (screenshot). 

 This would be very crucial to manage large number of datasets for big projects.
column174: 27/Aug/19 8:55 AM;rn19gaw;[~hh16leh] I've already seen the wireframes on Figma for this issue. Do we already have a ticket?
column175: 27/Aug/19 9:02 AM;hh16leh;Yes, we planned to have more flexible and filterable overview of datasets (grouped by date of processing). But not as part of the internal MVP. Maybe you can paste the relevant link to the wireframe here, so we can get feedback by [~sb15cag] if this would help in his opinion.

column1: Datasets are expected to be labelled "Processed" instead of original "Unprocessed", once the processing is done
column25:
Once someone has processed an uploaded dataset, I would expect it to be labelled as "*Processed*" instead of the current label "*Unprocessed*". 

As in the screenshot, both datasets have been successfully processed, but are still labeled as "Unprocessed".
column174: 26/Aug/19 2:38 PM;lc17zek;is this actually a bug [~hh16leh]
column175:
26/Aug/19 2:51 PM;hh16leh;It's a bug in the sense that we did not properly implement the dynamic behaviour of the labels ;-)

Duplicate of CTP-72, I suggest to fix this as part of IS-1198 (see last point of the ticket).

column1: Would be good to be able to see the list of datasets under a Processing Task
column25: Currently there is no way to see which of the datasets are already added/belongs to a processing task. Would be nice to have this feature.
column174:
26/Aug/19 2:53 PM;hh16leh;Totally agree, thanks for reporting!

This will be tackled via IV-2810.

column1: Cannot Edit or Delete Processing Task
column25: h2. Description: Once a *Processing Task* is being created, it cannot be deleted or edited. Also there is no way to see which datasets are under a certain processing task, not it alerts if a dataset is added to more than one processing task.
column174:
26/Aug/19 2:55 PM;hh16leh;These issues will be solved via IV-2810 and IS-1198.

Note that a dataset should be processable multiple times (e.g. if you want to have multiple different resolutions).

column1: Dataset is available to Processing task immediately as soon as the upload starts
column25:
h2. Description: A dataset is available to the *Processing Task* as soon as the upload is started. The can be added to the processing task. If a processing task is created with the upload in progress dataset and later the upload is cancelled, the processing task cannot be deleted. 

h2. Expected result: Dataset available to processing task only if the upload is complete or an indication of incomplete upload appears under the *Processing task* 

h3. Instance URL: http://test-test-cloud-processing-15:8080/iv/
column174: 26/Aug/19 4:58 PM;hh16leh;Being able to select datasets for a processing task while the upload is still ongoing is actually a feature, not a bug. Was it confusing for you? If so, why?
column175: 28/Aug/19 10:26 AM;sb15cag;[~hh16leh] It wasn't confusing to me but was just concerned. For example, if a processing task is created with multiple datasets where some are completely uploaded and some still uploading. The processing task is started expecting the ones already upload would be processed first and in meantime, the ongoing upload would be complete and hence, processing would be smooth and complete, for all. Not sure how the scheduling happens, but I see probabilities of failure under such circumstances.
column176:
28/Aug/19 10:32 AM;hh16leh;In the cloud, we do process per dataset. This means, we can start processing as soon as the upload of a dataset is finished which leads to shorter combined upload+processing time in total.

We still do have to handle the case properly when you set up a processing task with a dataset that is still uploading and the upload fails though.

column1: Hitting Cancel once a dataset uploading started, does not stops the upload
column25:
h2. Description: Once a dataset upload has started, trying to cancel the upload manually does not have an effect i.e. Hitting the *Cancel* button seems to have no effect. Uploading seems to keep continuing as the Time counter keeps changing 

h2. Expected result: Hitting *Cancel* cancels the task immediately.  

h3. Instance URL: http://test-test-cloud-processing-15:8080/iv/
column174: 26/Aug/19 4:57 PM;hh16leh;Hmmm, I'm not able to reproduce this. When I hit the Cancel button in the upload screen, it stops the upload immediately.
column175: 29/Aug/19 10:57 AM;hh16leh;We still do not know how to reproduce it but we could observe it once now as well. We'll investigate as part of IV-2874
column176: 29/Aug/19 11:47 AM;sb15cag;I would be happy to try this out again, if I have access to another test instance. May be in the second test phase.

column1: Uploaded 3 datasets, refreshed the instance in between, can see only the last dataset under My Uploaded Data
column25:
h2. Description: Attempted uploading 3 datasets, upload progress was being shown, but refreshed in middle. In the end I only see the last dataset (during whose upload, the instance was not refreshed). 

h2. Expected result: Upload happens in background. Once started does not terminates unless *Cancel*ed manually. 

h3. Instance URL:  http://test-test-cloud-processing-15:8080/iv/

h3. Related Ticket https://jira.navvis.com/browse/CTP-96
column174:
26/Aug/19 4:52 PM;hh16leh;Thanks for reporting! 

We will improve this by also showing incomplete datasets in the overview in IV-2869. With this, there is at least a way of cleaning up data.

Proper support for resuming an incomplete upload will be added later.

column1: Upload progress is invisible if instance is refreshed in middle
column25:
h2. Description: Refreshing the instance when the dataset is being uploaded hides the uploading progress bar/status and the only way to see it again is to upload another dataset. 

h2. Expected result: There is a way to see the current running upload dataset task without having to initiate another upload

h2. Steps To Reproduce:
# Upload a dataset
# refresh the page
# go to *My Uploaded Data* -> here only the original screen/prompt is visible. 

h3. Instance URL: http://test-test-cloud-processing-15:8080/iv/
column174:
26/Aug/19 2:58 PM;hh16leh;If you refresh the page while uploading, the upload will get cancelled (same as when you close the tab). 

We will introduce a warning that warns user if they want to close the tab (or refresh) while an upload is ongoing in IV-2867

column1: Choice of options when you log in : UI Related
column25:
Once you log in the welcome message shows only *upload your data*. Would be nice to be able to select what you want to do, hence jump to the particular section from the welcome screen. 

For Example 

Case 1:  No data in the instance (new instance). Choices could be 1. Upload Your Data for IV, 2. Upload Data for Processing
Case 2: There are some data uploaded (raw data and/or web processed data), choices could be 1. Process already uploaded data, 2. Upload new data for Processing, 3. Add data to instance, etc, etc 

These are just sample suggestions :) Happy to discuss more.
column174: 26/Aug/19 3:01 PM;hh16leh;[~rn19gaw], let's also discuss this.

column1: Could not find the dataset mangagement
column25:
The workflow of uploading and creating a processing task was quite straight forward.

But when I wanted to look at my data in an instance I struggled after copying the dataset to the dataset management. I never worked with IV, so this might be due to that.

I had no idea where to find the dataset management. A link/pointer would have been nice.

Or opening the dataset management as soon as the datasets have been copied. Something like Adobe Reader has when you extract a file (show file after extracting).
column174: 26/Aug/19 2:52 PM;hh16leh;Will be discussed with [~rn19gaw]. We could add a button to link to the Dataset Management here.
column175: 27/Aug/19 8:25 AM;rn19gaw;[~hh16leh] How long can it take to copy several datasets to the dataset management? It should be quite fast - but can it take so long that in the meantime the user is leaving the page (while the copy process is still in the background)?
column176: 27/Aug/19 8:47 AM;hh16leh;Since we are moving potentially a few GB over network (a user can also copy multiple datasets at once), it can take a few seconds to even minutes. So yes, it's a likely scenario that a user leaves the page while it's ongoing.

column1: Uploading datasets - feature requests
column25:
To make the upload of datasets easier, I would like to have the following:
 * Planned: dynamic feedback for the drag and drop field. it should detect when a file is placed in the field (like Jira does when you attach a file)
 * Need more info: Would be nice to be able to adjust the order of the files waiting to get uploaded by drag and drop.
 * Planned: An info message could warn, that the upload tab should stay in focus and should not be closed (maybe there was one, but I do not remember seeing one)
 * Needs UX: The progress bar while uploading is nice and helpful. Having additional progress bars for each dataset would be even better.
 * Needs UX: I like that the dataset name gets automatically extracted. If I could change it while uploading, would be even better
 * Planned / Later: Having a preview of the dataset would help a lot to select the correct dataset
column174: 20/Aug/19 4:34 PM;mk19wep;Design and Usability feature requests  --> [~rn19gaw] [~lc17zek]
column175:
26/Aug/19 4:50 PM;hh16leh;Ideally, we will not have to have the tab focused after solving IV-2868.

A warning if a user wants to close the IV tab while an upload is ongoing will be introduced in IV-2867

column1: Datasets took very long to upload
column25:
I tried to upload 5 datasets, each smaller than 2GB. The upload duration increased to more than 11 hours, even though I had a separate tab open.

I closed the browser, knowing that the files would be gone, if not fully uploaded, but it would be nice if there would still be the name of the datasets with a message, that they have not been uploaded.
column174:
20/Aug/19 4:32 PM;mk19wep;Slow upload will be investigated as part of CTP-78. 

 

[~hh16leh] will add ticket in IV backlog for the second issue.

column1: Processed dataset does not show configuration or individual names
column25:
I processed the same dataset twice, one time with 20mm resolution and one time with 5mm resolution. I gave both processing tasks individual names, but in the processed dataset tab, I can only read the dataset name and not the name of the processing task.

This makes it impossible for me to know, which dataset was processed with 5mm and which with 20mm resolution.

Additionaly, I could not find a way how to check the selected configuration of the processed data.
column174:
20/Aug/19 4:29 PM;mk19wep;usability issue --> [~rn19gaw] [~lc17zek]

there is already a ticket in IV backlog IS-1198

column1: CTP - Bug report - Missing Upload Indication
column25:
*Description*: when trying to upload the datasets_rec folder or datasets folder per drag&drop there is no indication on the "drop"-area on the webpage if the data will be received. It took roughly 30sec unless i see the progress bar that upload is starting.

*Expected Behavior*:when drag&drop a dataset folder onto the area on the web page any indicator (like greyed box) if the data will be recieved would be helpful. Otherwise l try to  drag multiple times the same folder unless i see any indication that it works.

*Browser*: Firefox 68.0.1 (64bit)

URL: http://test-test-cloud-processing-8:8080/iv/

*Datasets*: smb://nv-nas.ads.navvis.com/mappings/Schaeffler_HS/datasets_rec (one industrial area, 7 scans each 30GB)

column1: PPaaS: Attempting to download multiple pointcloud does not work
column25:
h2. Description:

After the completion of multiple processing tasks, I selected a couple of datasets on the "Processed Data" and attempted to download their pointclouds. Only one pointcloud was downloaded, and it's not clear which pointcloud that is.
h2. Expected result:
 * The pointclouds from all selected datasets are downloaded
 * The pointclouds have unique names related to the datasets from which they were generated

h2. Steps To Reproduce:
 # Process a multiple datasets
 # Go to the "Processed Data" page
 # Select two or more datasets
 # Click "Download Point Cloud" button
 # Wait for the pointclouds to download
 # Only one pointcloud is downloaded. It's name is "pointcloud.ply" which doesn't tell to which dataset it belongs.

h2. Environment:
h3. OS, Browser:

Ubuntu 18.04 - Chrome 73.0.3683.75
h3. Instance URL:

[http://test-test-cloud-processing-7:8080/iv/]
column174: 20/Aug/19 4:06 PM;ne42guw;[~hh16leh] take a look at [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTObjectGET.html] in the section about content disposition, in particular the filename parameter.
column175:
26/Aug/19 2:46 PM;hh16leh;I could not reproduce the first issue (downloading multiple point cloud files at once). When I select multiple datasets and click on the button, two downloads are triggered for files {{pointcloud.ply}} and {{pointcloud (1).ply}}.

The naming issue will be tackled.
column176: 26/Aug/19 3:00 PM;ma18waq;[~hh16leh], thank you. I'm confirming your findings. The first issue does not happen for me anymore either; I can download multiple clouds at the same time without a problem.
column177:
26/Aug/19 4:49 PM;hh16leh;Thanks for confirming.

The file name improvement will be done in IV-2870

column1: PPaaS: Unfinished processing tasks for two days
column25:
h2. Description:

I have created a couple of processing tasks for multiple datasets each, they have been running for two days, but they are still unfinished.
h2. Expected result:

Processing goes through successfully, or explicitly fails or times out when there is a technical problem.
h2. Steps To Reproduce:
 # Upload several datasets (I uploaded some calibration datasets for M6-4-003 IMMS. They can be found in smb://nv-nas/map/Trolley_setup/M6-4-003/rev0/input_datasets)
 # Create two processing tasks, each one is using a group of datasets
 # Make sure that the two processing tasks overlap (at least two datasets are selected in both tasks)
 # Wait for the processing to finish

h2. Hints:
 # Please note that the above steps are not necessarily the exact required steps to reproduce the issue, but it's how it happened on my machine. Therefore, keep in mind that the issue might not have anything to do with the two overlapping processing tasks.
 # [~rn17xaw] confirmed that the post-processing was stuck on AWS batch at the pointcloud generation stage. Robin suggests that it might be related to Docker containers running out of disk space. To be verified.

h2. Environment:
h3. OS, Browser:

Ubuntu 18.04 - Chrome 73.0.3683.75
h3. Instance URL:
[http://test-test-cloud-processing-7:8080/iv/]
column174: 19/Aug/19 10:54 AM;pm18pil;[~ma18waq], [~rn17xaw] Can you tell which of the datasets got stuck? We should be able to re-run with the new infrastructure which allocates space for containers dynamically as needed up to limit of the mounted volume (MAP-4352)
column175:
19/Aug/19 11:01 AM;ma18waq;[~pm18pil], one of the datasets is for sure *parking-lot (M6-4-004_parking-lot)*. This is the third processing task on the attached screenshot.

But AFAIK, there's no way to tell which dataset the other one was, because it was scheduled for processing among several other datasets. That's the first processing task on the attached screenshot.

column1: CTP - Bug report: PPaaS - Uploading a rec dataset failed
column25:
h2. Description:

Uploading a recorded dataset to my test instance got stuck at 0% and the time left kept increasing. After leaving the window open for a few hours, the Chrome tab froze and had to be refreshed.

After some investigation, the root cause of this problem appears to be that the sensor_frame.xml file was owned by another user without read/write permissions to group or others.
h2. Expected 
 * The upload process goes through without errors, or
 * If upload failed due to any reason, e.g. files being inaccessible, a graceful error message is displayed, so that the user can retry manually or fix the issue

h2. Steps To Reproduce:
 # Open the terminal and go to any recorded dataset
 # Change the ownership and permissions for the sensor_frame.xml file, so that it's owned by another user without read/write permissions to 'group' nor 'others':
 ## Execute `sudo chown gi23kuj sensor_frame.xml` 
 ## Execute `sudo chmod 700 sensor_frame.xml`
 # Go to your Proc on Cloud instance
 # Go to  Cloud Processing
 # Go to Uploaded Data
 # Click Upload recorded data
 # Select the dataset from step 1
 # Notice how the upload is initiated, but it gets stuck and the time left keeps increasing

 

Also, this might be irrelevant, but I noticed a few GET requests to https://cloud-processing-storage-manager.s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com that got a 404 response. It doesn't seem to be affecting the normal workflow when the upload is running normally, though.
h2. Environment:
h3. OS, Browser: Ubuntu 18.04 - Chrome 73.0.3683.75

Console log is attached.
h3. Instance URL:

[http://test-test-cloud-processing-7:8080/iv/]
column174: 14/Aug/19 1:51 PM;hh16leh;Thanks for reporting, [~ma18waq]! We will look into this issue via IV-2855
